Title: Rats Play Doom
Description: We built a complete VR setup from scratch to let rats play DOOM. The system includes a motion-tracked treadmill ball, a panoramic headset, an input trigger, and a reward circuit. All hardware and software components are open sourced, including 3D-printable designs, circuit diagrams, firmware, and control software.

Title: 20 Years of Digital Life, Gone in an Instant, thanks to Apple
Description:
Summary: A major brick-and-mortar store sold an Apple Gift Card that Apple seemingly took offence to, and locked out my entire Apple ID, effectively bricking my devices and my iCloud Account, Apple Developer ID, and everything associated with it, and I have no recourse. Can you help? Email paris AT paris.id.au (and read on for the details). ❤️
Here’s how Apple “Permanently” locked my Apple ID.
I am writing this as a desperate measure.

Title: VACUUM Is a Lie (About Your Indexes)
Description: PostgreSQL VACUUM cleans tables but leaves indexes bloated. Learn why B-trees fragment and how to fix them properly.

Title: blog/2025/04/semantic-versioning-is-hard.mld
Description: Let's take the case that hit me this morning. I've been working on ocaml-docs-ci in order to bring the exciting new odoc 3 features to ocaml.org for everyone to enjoy. I have it checked out and building locally, but to deploy it to the infrastructure managed by Mark Elvers it needs to be packaged up into a Docker image. Title: Software engineering: Should it be a product, or a craft?
Description: I always had strong opinions about the value of craftsmanship, and of product as a kind of fake replica of craft. I still think that product is something falsely glorified in the hyper-commercialized world we live in today, while craftsmanship is the actual value-adding component of everything we build. But

Description: Can autonomous AI coding be used to build a SaaS product from scratch? A practical experiment puts it to the test.

Title: magit-insert-worktrees improves status buffers
Description: When using Emacs' Magit and Git worktrees, adding the magit-insert-worktrees section inserter gives an nice overview of them in the status buffer.

Title: Using Calibri on .gov sites • Cory Dransfeldt
Description: [The US government is run by petty morons that are threatened by a font.](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/rubio-stages-font-coup-times-new-roman-ousts-calibri-2025-12-09/) But because the web is the web, you can at least force `.gov` sites to render all text using Calibri.

Title: Holimization: Why Optimization Is Not Enough
Description: Joannes Vermorel introduces Holimization: why classical optimization fails in messy supply chains, and how reframing objectives, data and constraints turns failures into learning.

Title: Migrating Schema from Oracle to YugabyteDB using HexaRocket | HexaCluster
